Text.Value: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.
Ravengard blood runs through Wyll's veins. I choose to trust. I hope you choose to honour it.
At ease.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Florrick and her guards stows their weapons and are at ease
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

Text.Value: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Your father trained you in the ways of the great champions. You are to use those lessons to wake the wyrm under the city. He is oathbound to answer your call and come to our aid.
Baldur's Gate stands on the brink of the abyss. Let's awaken the wyrm, and take back the city.
I thought you were going to save him, but you abused his current state to get rid of him!
Wyll, there's something you must know. I should've told you sooner, but I'd hoped somehow your father would return to us.
What darkness has fallen upon us.
I will go and assemble any allies I can find. When the battle horns call, we'll stand ready.
Your father gave it to me, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.
Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.
We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.
Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.
Dead. So once more, fortune turns against us.
The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.
I would like to know more about this wyrm.
The fate of the city now rests with us.
Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you prize his ways, you'll seek out the wyrm.
Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.
Probe Florrick's mind.
We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.
Florrick, what are you on about - what is this?
The Blade of Frontiers - all pomp and empty oaths. The Sword Coast's most dashing fraud.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Florrick stops in front ofr Wyll and spits at the ground near Wyll feet.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick spits on the ground in front of Wyll before addressing him. He is taken aback.
EditorData.NodeContext: Please include Florricking Spitting (motion and sound) before delivering the line.

Text.Value: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
That meddling ghoul. Florrick, I -
Florrick. I am my father's son. You know me. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?
A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.
The dragon Ansur is dead, Florrick.

EditorData.logicalname: |Already dealt with Ansur, doesn't have helm|

Text.Value: Wyll? What do you make of this?
The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
*Your thoughts come up short.*
Unleash the wyrm, Wyll - let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. Good luck!
Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.
I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.
You're going to trust him? You do know he made a pact with a devil, right?
Yet I came through, I did what was right. You butchered Ulder like the devils you are.
Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.
It's true, Florrick. You can't believe her. She's a devil. Will you really trust her word over mine?
Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.
You mean to make the city bow to you and you alone!
Godsdamned hypocrite.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Florrick and her guards march angryily towards Wyll looking very angry at him
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

EditorData.stateContext: Florrick and company in attack position

Text.Value: Then your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!
How easily the lies fall from your tongue.
Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.
What lessons do you mean?
Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!
This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - we need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.
Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. I remember them well. Father made me recite them every morning.
Before the Absolutists abducted him, he told me that should he fall, I must seek you out and give you this message.
When we found you in prison, you'd given up. Who's the hypocrite here?
A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?
Your faith in Wyll is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.
Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.
A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.
Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.
He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.
May your father's courage be with you, Wyll. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.
He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.
I trusted you. I believed in you.
By the living gods, I believe you.
Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.
A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
This is no ordinary dragon.
My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!
Save it. My duty is to Baldur's Gate - and it holds no place for Ravengard's treacherous spawn.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Florrick and the guards draw their weapons
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

Text.Value: Let it set the path before you.
*You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*
The duke gave me this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Since then the city faced countless threats - but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. But this time, things are different.
The dragon Ansur is dead.
Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

EditorData.logicalname: Skill_Persuasion - was in IRN broken pact

EditorData.stateContext: Florrick and her companions are at ease

Synopsis: Confrontation with Florrick if Ravengard died.
